verses.text: And he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, because of the quarrelling of the people of Israel, and because they tested the Lord by saying, “Is the Lord among us or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to Joshua, “Choose for us men, and go out and fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the staff of God in my hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua did as Moses told him, and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed, and whenever he lowered his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses' hands grew weary, so they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it, while Aaron and Hur held up his hands, one on one side, and the other on the other side. So his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua overwhelmed Amalek and his people with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write this as a memorial in a book and recite it in the ears of Joshua, that I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses built an altar and called the name of it, The Lord Is My Banner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “A hand upon the throne of the Lord! The Lord will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses' father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses and for Israel his people, how the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, had taken Zipporah, Moses' wife, after he had sent her home,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with her two sons. The name of one was Gershom (for he said, “I have been a sojourner in a foreign land”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the name of the other, Eliezer (for he said, “The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses in the wilderness where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and her two sons with her,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law and bowed down and kissed him. And they asked each other of their welfare and went into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, all the hardship that had come upon them in the way, and how the Lord had delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro rejoiced for all the good that the Lord had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro said, “Blessed be the Lord, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians and out of the hand of Pharaoh and has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I know that the Lord is greater than all gods, because in this affair they dealt arrogantly with the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices to God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses' father-in-law before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from morning till evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses' father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people, he said, “What is this that you are doing for the people? Why do you sit alone, and all the people stand around you from morning till evening?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to enquire of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they have a dispute, they come to me and I decide between one person and another, and I make them know the statutes of God and his laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses' father-in-law said to him, “What you are doing is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You and the people with you will certainly wear yourselves out, for the thing is too heavy for you. You are not able to do it alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now obey my voice; I will give you advice, and God be with you! You shall represent the people before God and bring their cases to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall warn them about the statutes and the laws, and make them know the way in which they must walk and what they must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, look for able men from all the people, men who fear God, who are trustworthy and hate a bribe, and place such men over the people as chiefs of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them judge the people at all times. Every great matter they shall bring to you, but any small matter they shall decide themselves. So it will be easier for you, and they will bear the burden with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do this, God will direct you, you will be able to endure, and all this people also will go to their place in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses listened to the voice of his father-in-law and did all that he had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses chose able men out of all Israel and made them heads over the people, chiefs of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they judged the people at all times. Any hard case they brought to Moses, but any small matter they decided themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went away to his own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third new moon after the people of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on that day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rephidim and came into the wilderness of Sinai, and they encamped in the wilderness. There Israel encamped before the mountain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while Moses went up to God. The Lord called to him out of the mountain, saying, “Thus you shall say to the house of Jacob, and tell the people of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles' wings and brought you to myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice and keep my covenant, you shall be my treasured possession among all peoples, for all the earth is mine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall be to me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation. These are the words that you shall speak to the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses came and called the elders of the people and set before them all these words that the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people answered together and said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do.” And Moses reported the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Lord said to Moses, “Behold, I am coming to you in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with you, and may also believe you for ever.”
When Moses told the words of the people to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord said to Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their garments
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be ready for the third day. For on the third day the Lord will come down on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set limits for the people all round, saying, ‘Take care not to go up into the mountain or touch the edge of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No hand shall touch him, but he shall be stoned or shot; whether beast or man, he shall not live.’ When the trumpet sounds a long blast, they shall come up to the mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and consecrated the people; and they washed their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day; do not go near a woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the morning of the third day there were thunders and lightnings and a thick cloud on the mountain and a very loud trumpet blast, so that all the people in the camp trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet God, and they took their stand at the foot of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mount Sinai was wrapped in smoke because the Lord had descended on it in fire. The smoke of it went up like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountain trembled greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him in thunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came down on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain. And the Lord called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Go down and warn the people, lest they break through to the Lord to look and many of them perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also let the priests who come near to the Lord consecrate themselves, lest the Lord break out against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to the Lord, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for you yourself warned us, saying, ‘Set limits round the mountain and consecrate it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “Go down, and come up bringing Aaron with you. But do not let the priests and the people break through to come up to the Lord, lest he break out against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down to the people and told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke all these words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall have no other gods before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I the Lord your God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and the fourth generation of those who hate me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labour, and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, you, or your son, or your daughter, your male servant, or your female servant, or your livestock, or the sojourner who is within your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested on the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honour your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not covet your neighbour's house; you shall not covet your neighbour's wife, or his male servant, or his female servant, or his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbour's.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the people saw the thunder and the flashes of lightning and the sound of the trumpet and the mountain smoking, the people were afraid and trembled, and they stood far off
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Moses, “You speak to us, and we will listen; but do not let God speak to us, lest we die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the people, “Do not fear, for God has come to test you, that the fear of him may be before you, that you may not sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood far off, while Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the people of Israel: ‘You have seen for yourselves that I have talked with you from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make gods of silver to be with me, nor shall you make for yourselves gods of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An altar of earth you shall make for me and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I cause my name to be remembered I will come to you and bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you make me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stones, for if you wield your tool on it you profane it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not go up by steps to my altar, that your nakedness be not exposed on it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now these are the rules that you shall set before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you buy a Hebrew slave, he shall serve for six years, and in the seventh he shall go out free, for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes in single, he shall go out single; if he comes in married, then his wife shall go out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall be her master's, and he shall go out alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the slave plainly says, ‘I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free’,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his master shall bring him to God, and he shall bring him to the door or the doorpost. And his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall be his slave for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man sells his daughter as a slave, she shall not go out as the male slaves do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she does not please her master, who has designated her for himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no right to sell her to a foreign people, since he has broken faith with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he designates her for his son, he shall deal with her as with a daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he takes another wife to himself, he shall not diminish her food, her clothing, or her marital rights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he does not do these three things for her, she shall go out for nothing, without payment of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever strikes a man so that he dies shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he did not lie in wait for him, but God let him fall into his hand, then I will appoint for you a place to which he may flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a man wilfully attacks another to kill him by cunning, you shall take him from my altar, that he may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever steals a man and sells him, and anyone found in possession of him, shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever curses his father or his mother shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When men quarrel and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist and the man does not die but takes to his bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then if the man rises again and walks outdoors with his staff, he who struck him shall be clear; only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall have him thoroughly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man strikes his slave, male or female, with a rod and the slave dies under his hand, he shall be avenged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the slave survives a day or two, he is not to be avenged, for the slave is his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When men strive together and hit a pregnant woman, so that her children come out, but there is no harm, the one who hit her shall surely be fined, as the woman's husband shall impose on him, and he shall pay as the judges determine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is harm, then you shall pay life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burn for burn, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man strikes the eye of his slave, male or female, and destroys it, he shall let the slave go free because of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he knocks out the tooth of his slave, male or female, he shall let the slave go free because of his tooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox shall not be liable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the ox has been accustomed to gore in the past, and its owner has been warned but has not kept it in, and it kills a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned, and its owner also shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a ransom is imposed on him, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatever is imposed on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it gores a man's son or daughter, he shall be dealt with according to this same rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the ox gores a slave, male or female, the owner shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man opens a pit, or when a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit shall make restoration. He shall give money to its owner, and the dead beast shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When one man's ox butts another's, so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and share its price, and the dead beast also they shall share.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if it is known that the ox has been accustomed to gore in the past, and its owner has not kept it in, he shall repay ox for ox, and the dead beast shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and kills it or sells it, he shall repay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a thief is found breaking in and is struck so that he dies, there shall be no bloodguilt for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if the sun has risen on him, there shall be bloodguilt for him. He shall surely pay. If he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the stolen beast is found alive in his possession, whether it is an ox or a donkey or a sheep, he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man causes a field or vineyard to be grazed over, or lets his beast loose and it feeds in another man's field, he shall make restitution from the best in his own field and in his own vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If fire breaks out and catches in thorns so that the stacked corn or the standing corn or the field is consumed, he who started the fire shall make full restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man gives to his neighbour money or goods to keep safe, and it is stolen from the man's house, then, if the thief is found, he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief is not found, the owner of the house shall come near to God to show whether or not he has put his hand to his neighbour's property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every breach of trust, whether it is for an ox, for a donkey, for a sheep, for a cloak, or for any kind of lost thing, of which one says, ‘This is it,’ the case of both parties shall come before God. The one whom God condemns shall pay double to his neighbour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man gives to his neighbour a donkey or an ox or a sheep or any beast to keep safe, and it dies or is injured or is driven away, without anyone seeing it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: an oath by the Lord shall be between them both to see whether or not he has put his hand to his neighbour's property. The owner shall accept the oath, and he shall not make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is torn by beasts, let him bring it as evidence. He shall not make restitution for what has been torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man borrows anything of his neighbour, and it is injured or dies, the owner not being with it, he shall make full restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the owner was with it, he shall not make restitution; if it was hired, it came for its hiring fee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man seduces a virgin who is not betrothed and lies with her, he shall give the bride price for her and make her his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money equal to the bride price for virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not permit a sorceress to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever sacrifices to any god, other than the Lord alone, shall be devoted to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not wrong a sojourner or oppress him, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not mistreat any widow or fatherless child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do mistreat them, and they cry out to me, I will surely hear their cry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my wrath will burn, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives shall become widows and your children fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you lend money to any of my people with you who is poor, you shall not be like a money-lender to him, and you shall not exact interest from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ever you take your neighbour's cloak in pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that is his only covering, and it is his cloak for his body; in what else shall he sleep? And if he cries to me, I will hear, for I am compassionate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not revile God, nor curse a ruler of your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not delay to offer from the fullness of your harvest and from the outflow of your presses. The firstborn of your sons you shall give to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do the same with your oxen and with your sheep: for seven days it shall be with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall be consecrated to me. Therefore you shall not eat any flesh that is torn by beasts in the field; you shall throw it to the dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not spread a false report. You shall not join hands with a wicked man to be a malicious witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not fall in with the many to do evil, nor shall you bear witness in a lawsuit, siding with the many, so as to pervert justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall you be partial to a poor man in his lawsuit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you meet your enemy's ox or his donkey going astray, you shall bring it back to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see the donkey of one who hates you lying down under its burden, you shall refrain from leaving him with it; you shall rescue it with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not pervert the justice due to your poor in his lawsuit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep far from a false charge, and do not kill the innocent and righteous, for I will not acquit the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds the clear-sighted and subverts the cause of those who are in the right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not oppress a sojourner. You know the heart of a sojourner, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what they leave the beasts of the field may eat. You shall do likewise with your vineyard, and with your olive orchard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall rest; that your ox and your donkey may have rest, and the son of your servant woman, and the alien, may be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pay attention to all that I have said to you, and make no mention of the names of other gods, nor let it be heard on your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Three times in the year you shall keep a feast to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. As I commanded you, you shall eat unleavened bread for seven days at the appointed time in the month of Abib, for in it you came out of Egypt. None shall appear before me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep the Feast of Harvest, of the firstfruits of your labour, of what you sow in the field. You shall keep the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in from the field the fruit of your labour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times in the year shall all your males appear before the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with anything leavened, or let the fat of my feast remain until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The best of the firstfruits of your ground you shall bring into the house of the Lord your God.
“You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I send an angel before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay careful attention to him and obey his voice; do not rebel against him, for he will not pardon your transgression, for my name is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you carefully obey his voice and do all that I say, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When my angel goes before you and brings you to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites, the Hivites and the Jebusites, and I blot them out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not bow down to their gods nor serve them, nor do as they do, but you shall utterly overthrow them and break their pillars in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall serve the Lord your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take sickness away from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None shall miscarry or be barren in your land; I will fulfil the number of your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send my terror before you and will throw into confusion all the people against whom you shall come, and I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send hornets before you, which shall drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased and possess the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will set your border from the Red Sea to the Sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates, for I will give the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me; for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel, and worship from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses alone shall come near to the Lord, but the others shall not come near, and the people shall not come up with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord and all the rules. And all the people answered with one voice and said, “All the words that the Lord has spoken we will do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses wrote down all the words of the Lord. He rose early in the morning and built an altar at the foot of the mountain, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent young men of the people of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and half of the blood he threw against the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read it in the hearing of the people. And they said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do, and we will be obedient.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took the blood and threw it on the people and said, “Behold the blood of the covenant that the Lord has made with you in accordance with all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel went up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they saw the God of Israel. There was under his feet as it were a pavement of sapphire stone, like the very heaven for clearness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not lay his hand on the chief men of the people of Israel; they beheld God, and ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain and wait there, that I may give you the tablets of stone, with the law and the commandment, which I have written for their instruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses rose with his assistant Joshua, and Moses went up into the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we return to you. And behold, Aaron and Hur are with you. Whoever has a dispute, let him go to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up on the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of the Lord dwelt on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days. And on the seventh day he called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the appearance of the glory of the Lord was like a devouring fire on the top of the mountain in the sight of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses entered the cloud and went up on the mountain. And Moses was on the mountain for forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel, that they take for me a contribution. From every man whose heart moves him you shall receive the contribution for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the contribution that you shall receive from them: gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, goats' hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: tanned rams' skins, goatskins, acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for the lamps, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exactly as I show you concerning the pattern of the tabernacle, and of all its furniture, so you shall make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall make an ark of acacia wood. Two cubits and a half shall be its length, a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and outside shall you overlay it, and you shall make on it a moulding of gold round it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall cast four rings of gold for it and put them on its four feet, two rings on one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark; they shall not be taken from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put into the ark the testimony that I shall give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold. Two cubits and a half shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make two cherubim of gold; of hammered work shall you make them, on the two ends of the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make one cherub on one end, and one cherub on the other end. Of one piece with the mercy seat shall you make the cherubim on its two ends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim shall spread out their wings above, overshadowing the mercy seat with their wings, their faces one to another; towards the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put the mercy seat on the top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony that I shall give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I will meet with you, and from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim that are on the ark of the testimony, I will speak with you about all that I will give you in commandment for the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a table of acacia wood. Two cubits shall be its length, a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold and make a moulding of gold round it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make a rim round it a handbreadth wide, and a moulding of gold round the rim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for it four rings of gold, and fasten the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Close to the frame the rings shall lie, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, and the table shall be carried with these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make its plates and dishes for incense, and its flagons and bowls with which to pour drink offerings; you shall make them of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set the bread of the Presence on the table before me regularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand shall be made of hammered work: its base, its stem, its cups, its calyxes, and its flowers shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be six branches going out of its sides, three branches of the lampstand out of one side of it and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three cups made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on one branch, and three cups made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on the other branch—so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups made like almond blossoms, with their calyxes and flowers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a calyx of one piece with it under each pair of the six branches going out from the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their calyxes and their branches shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single piece of hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make seven lamps for it. And the lamps shall be set up so as to give light on the space in front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its tongs and their trays shall be of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be made, with all these utensils, out of a talent of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And see that you make them after the pattern for them, which is being shown you on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet yarns; you shall make them with cherubim skilfully worked into them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains shall be the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five curtains shall be coupled to one another, and the other five curtains shall be coupled to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make loops of blue on the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set. Likewise you shall make loops on the edge of the outermost curtain in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fifty loops you shall make on the one curtain, and fifty loops you shall make on the edge of the curtain that is in the second set; the loops shall be opposite one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains one to the other with the clasps, so that the tabernacle may be a single whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle; eleven curtains shall you make.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. The eleven curtains shall be the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and the sixth curtain you shall double over at the front of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make fifty clasps of bronze, and put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together that it may be a single whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the part that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the extra that remains in the length of the curtains, the cubit on one side, and the cubit on the other side, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle, on this side and that side, to cover it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for the tent a covering of tanned rams' skins and a covering of goatskins on top.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make upright frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a frame, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be two tenons in each frame, for fitting together. So shall you do for all the frames of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the frames for the tabernacle: twenty frames for the south side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forty bases of silver you shall make under the twenty frames, two bases under one frame for its two tenons, and two bases under the next frame for its two tenons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side twenty frames,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty bases of silver, two bases under one frame, and two bases under the next frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the rear of the tabernacle westward you shall make six frames.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make two frames for corners of the tabernacle in the rear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they shall be separate beneath, but joined at the top, at the first ring. Thus shall it be with both of them; they shall form the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be eight frames, with their bases of silver, sixteen bases; two bases under one frame, and two bases under another frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make bars of acacia wood, five for the frames of one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the side of the tabernacle at the rear westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The middle bar, halfway up the frames, shall run from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay the frames with gold and shall make their rings of gold for holders for the bars, and you shall overlay the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall erect the tabernacle according to the plan for it that you were shown on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall make a veil of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen. It shall be made with cherubim skilfully worked into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, with hooks of gold, on four bases of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall hang the veil from the clasps, and bring the ark of the testimony in there within the veil. And the veil shall separate for you the Holy Place from the Most Holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony in the Most Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand on the south side of the tabernacle opposite the table, and you shall put the table on the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a screen for the entrance of the tent, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, embroidered with needlework.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia, and overlay them with gold. Their hooks shall be of gold, and you shall cast five bases of bronze for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits broad. The altar shall be square, and its height shall be three cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make horns for it on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it, and you shall overlay it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make pots for it to receive its ashes, and shovels and basins and forks and firepans. You shall make all its utensils of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also make for it a grating, a network of bronze, and on the net you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set it under the ledge of the altar so that the net extends halfway down the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the poles shall be put through the rings, so that the poles are on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make it hollow, with boards. As it has been shown you on the mountain, so shall it be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the court of the tabernacle. On the south side the court shall have hangings of fine twined linen a hundred cubits long for one side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its twenty pillars and their twenty bases shall be of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise for its length on the north side there shall be hangings a hundred cubits long, its pillars twenty and their bases twenty, of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the breadth of the court on the west side there shall be hangings for fifty cubits, with ten pillars and ten bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The breadth of the court on the front to the east shall be fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other side the hangings shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the gate of the court there shall be a screen twenty cubits long, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, embroidered with needlework. It shall have four pillars and with them four bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars round the court shall be filleted with silver. Their hooks shall be of silver, and their bases of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the court shall be a hundred cubits, the breadth fifty, and the height five cubits, with hangings of fine twined linen and bases of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the utensils of the tabernacle for every use, and all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall command the people of Israel that they bring to you pure beaten olive oil for the light, that a lamp may regularly be set up to burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tent of meeting, outside the veil that is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall tend it from evening to morning before the Lord. It shall be a statute for ever to be observed throughout their generations by the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then bring near to you Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, from among the people of Israel, to serve me as priests—Aaron and Aaron's sons, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to all the skilful, whom I have filled with a spirit of skill, that they make Aaron's garments to consecrate him for my priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the garments that they shall make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a coat of chequerwork, a turban, and a sash. They shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons to serve me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall receive gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and of fine twined linen, skilfully worked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall have two shoulder pieces attached to its two edges, so that it may be joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the skilfully woven band on it shall be made like it and be of one piece with it, of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take two onyx stones, and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a jeweller engraves signets, so shall you engrave the two stones with the names of the sons of Israel. You shall enclose them in settings of gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, as stones of remembrance for the sons of Israel. And Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord on his two shoulders for remembrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make settings of gold filigree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two chains of pure gold, twisted like cords; and you shall attach the corded chains to the settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a breastpiece of judgement, in skilled work. In the style of the ephod you shall make it—of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen shall you make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be square and doubled, a span its length and a span its breadth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set in it four rows of stones. A row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle shall be the first row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be set in gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be twelve stones with their names according to the names of the sons of Israel. They shall be like signets, each engraved with its name, for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for the breastpiece twisted chains like cords, of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for the breastpiece two rings of gold, and put the two rings on the two edges of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put the two cords of gold in the two rings at the edges of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two ends of the two cords you shall attach to the two settings of filigree, and so attach it in front to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two rings of gold, and put them at the two ends of the breastpiece, on its inside edge next to the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make two rings of gold, and attach them in front to the lower part of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, at its seam above the skilfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall bind the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, so that it may lie on the skilfully woven band of the ephod, so that the breastpiece shall not come loose from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel in the breastpiece of judgement on his heart, when he goes into the Holy Place, to bring them to regular remembrance before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the breastpiece of judgement you shall put the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be on Aaron's heart, when he goes in before the Lord. Thus Aaron shall bear the judgement of the people of Israel on his heart before the Lord regularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall have an opening for the head in the middle of it, with a woven binding round the opening, like the opening in a garment, so that it may not tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue and purple and scarlet yarns, round its hem, with bells of gold between them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, round the hem of the robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be on Aaron when he ministers, and its sound shall be heard when he goes into the Holy Place before the Lord, and when he comes out, so that he does not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving of a signet, ‘Holy to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall fasten it on the turban by a cord of blue. It shall be on the front of the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be on Aaron's forehead, and Aaron shall bear any guilt from the holy things that the people of Israel consecrate as their holy gifts. It shall regularly be on his forehead, that they may be accepted before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall weave the coat in chequerwork of fine linen, and you shall make a turban of fine linen, and you shall make a sash embroidered with needlework.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For Aaron's sons you shall make coats and sashes and caps. You shall make them for glory and beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put them on Aaron your brother, and on his sons with him, and shall anoint them and ordain them and consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for them linen undergarments to cover their naked flesh. They shall reach from the hips to the thighs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they go into the tent of meeting or when they come near the altar to minister in the Holy Place, lest they bear guilt and die. This shall be a statute for ever for him and for his offspring after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what you shall do to them to consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests. Take one bull of the herd and two rams without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers smeared with oil. You shall make them of fine wheat flour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them in one basket and bring them in the basket, and bring the bull and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take the garments, and put on Aaron the coat and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the skilfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set the turban on his head and put the holy crown on the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring his sons and put coats on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall gird Aaron and his sons with sashes and bind caps on them. And the priesthood shall be theirs by a statute for ever. Thus you shall ordain Aaron and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall bring the bull before the tent of meeting. Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall kill the bull before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall take part of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and the rest of the blood you shall pour out at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, and the long lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the flesh of the bull and its skin and its dung you shall burn with fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall take one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall kill the ram and shall take its blood and throw it against the sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall cut the ram into pieces, and wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and its head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord. It is a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall kill the ram and take part of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and on the tips of the right ears of his sons, and on the thumbs of their right hands and on the great toes of their right feet, and throw the rest of the blood against the sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take part of the blood that is on the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and his sons' garments with him. He and his garments shall be holy, and his sons and his sons' garments with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also take the fat from the ram and the fat tail and the fat that covers the entrails, and the long lobe of the liver and the two kidneys with the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of ordination),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one loaf of bread and one cake of bread made with oil, and one wafer out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and wave them for a wave offering before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take them from their hands and burn them on the altar on top of the burnt offering, as a pleasing aroma before the Lord. It is a food offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall take the breast of the ram of Aaron's ordination and wave it for a wave offering before the Lord, and it shall be your portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering that is waved and the thigh of the priests' portion that is contributed from the ram of ordination, from what was Aaron's and his sons'.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be for Aaron and his sons as a perpetual due from the people of Israel, for it is a contribution. It shall be a contribution from the people of Israel from their peace offerings, their contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him; they shall be anointed in them and ordained in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son who succeeds him as priest, who comes into the tent of meeting to minister in the Holy Place, shall wear them for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket in the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall eat those things with which atonement was made at their ordination and consecration, but an outsider shall not eat of them, because they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any of the flesh for the ordination or of the bread remain until the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall do to Aaron and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. Over seven days shall you ordain them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every day you shall offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement. Also you shall purify the altar, when you make atonement for it, and shall anoint it to consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and consecrate it, and the altar shall be most holy. Whatever touches the altar shall become holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two lambs a year old day by day regularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with the first lamb a tenth seah of fine flour mingled with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil, and a quarter of a hin of wine for a drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, and shall offer with it a grain offering and its drink offering, as in the morning, for a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a regular burnt offering throughout your generations at the entrance of the tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet with you, to speak to you there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I will meet with the people of Israel, and it shall be sanctified by my glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will consecrate the tent of meeting and the altar. Aaron also and his sons I will consecrate to serve me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will dwell among the people of Israel and will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt that I might dwell among them. I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make an altar on which to burn incense; you shall make it of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cubit shall be its length, and a cubit its breadth. It shall be square, and two cubits shall be its height. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top and round its sides and its horns. And you shall make a moulding of gold round it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make two golden rings for it. Under its moulding on two opposite sides of it you shall make them, and they shall be holders for poles with which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put it in front of the veil that is above the ark of the testimony, in front of the mercy seat that is above the testimony, where I will meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall burn fragrant incense on it. Every morning when he dresses the lamps he shall burn it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when Aaron sets up the lamps at twilight, he shall burn it, a regular incense offering before the Lord throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not offer unauthorized incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering, and you shall not pour a drink offering on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year. With the blood of the sin offering of atonement he shall make atonement for it once in the year throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you take the census of the people of Israel, then each shall give a ransom for his life to the Lord when you number them, that there be no plague among them when you number them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one who is numbered in the census shall give this: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs), half a shekel as an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who is numbered in the census, from twenty years old and upwards, shall give the Lord's offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when you give the Lord's offering to make atonement for your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the atonement money from the people of Israel and shall give it for the service of the tent of meeting, that it may bring the people of Israel to remembrance before the Lord, so as to make atonement for your lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a basin of bronze, with its stand of bronze, for washing. You shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with which Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they go into the tent of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister, to burn a food offering to the Lord, they shall wash with water, so that they may not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall wash their hands and their feet, so that they may not die. It shall be a statute for ever to them, even to him and to his offspring throughout their generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the finest spices: of liquid myrrh 500 shekels, and of sweet-smelling cinnamon half as much, that is, 250, and 250 of aromatic cane,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 500 of cassia, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and a hin of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make of these a sacred anointing oil blended as by the perfumer; it shall be a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With it you shall anoint the tent of meeting and the ark of the testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and all its utensils, and the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils and the basin and its stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall consecrate them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them will become holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to the people of Israel, ‘This shall be my holy anointing oil throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall not be poured on the body of an ordinary person, and you shall make no other like it in composition. It is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever compounds any like it or whoever puts any of it on an outsider shall be cut off from his people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Take sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum, sweet spices with pure frankincense (of each shall there be an equal part),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make an incense blended as by the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall beat some of it very small, and put part of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting where I shall meet with you. It shall be most holy for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the incense that you shall make according to its composition, you shall not make for yourselves. It shall be for you holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever makes any like it to use as perfume shall be cut off from his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with ability and intelligence, with knowledge and all craftsmanship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to devise artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, to work in every craft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan. And I have given to all able men ability, that they may make all that I have commanded you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tent of meeting, and the ark of the testimony, and the mercy seat that is on it, and all the furnishings of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and its utensils, and the pure lampstand with all its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin and its stand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the finely worked garments, the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, for their service as priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense for the Holy Place. According to all that I have commanded you, they shall do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to speak to the people of Israel and say, ‘Above all you shall keep my Sabbaths, for this is a sign between me and you throughout your generations, that you may know that I, the Lord, sanctify you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep the Sabbath, because it is holy for you. Everyone who profanes it shall be put to death. Whoever does any work on it, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days shall work be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to the Lord. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the people of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, observing the Sabbath throughout their generations, as a covenant for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sign for ever between me and the people of Israel that in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave to Moses, when he had finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron and said to him, “Up, make us gods who shall go before us. As for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron said to them, “Take off the rings of gold that are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people took off the rings of gold that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he received the gold from their hand and fashioned it with a graving tool and made a golden calf. And they said, “These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it. And Aaron made proclamation and said, “Tomorrow shall be a feast to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up early the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought peace offerings. And the people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Go down, for your people, whom you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned aside quickly out of the way that I commanded them. They have made for themselves a golden calf and have worshipped it and sacrificed to it and said, ‘These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may burn hot against them and I may consume them, in order that I may make a great nation of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses implored the Lord his God and said, “O Lord, why does your wrath burn hot against your people, whom you have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the Egyptians say, ‘With evil intent did he bring them out, to kill them in the mountains and to consume them from the face of the earth’? Turn from your burning anger and relent from this disaster against your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your own self, and said to them, ‘I will multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have promised I will give to your offspring, and they shall inherit it for ever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord relented from the disaster that he had spoken of bringing on his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses turned and went down from the mountain with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand, tablets that were written on both sides; on the front and on the back they were written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is a noise of war in the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “It is not the sound of shouting for victory, or the sound of the cry of defeat, but the sound of singing that I hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, Moses' anger burned hot, and he threw the tablets out of his hands and broke them at the foot of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the calf that they had made and burned it with fire and ground it to powder and scattered it on the water and made the people of Israel drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought such a great sin upon them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron said, “Let not the anger of my lord burn hot. You know the people, that they are set on evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they said to me, ‘Make us gods who shall go before us. As for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I said to them, ‘Let any who have gold take it off.’ So they gave it to me, and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses saw that the people had broken loose (for Aaron had let them break loose, to the derision of their enemies),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Moses stood in the gate of the camp and said, “Who is on the Lord's side? Come to me.” And all the sons of Levi gathered round him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘Put your sword on your side each of you, and go to and fro from gate to gate throughout the camp, and each of you kill his brother and his companion and his neighbour.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. And that day about three thousand men of the people fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator
