verses.text: And Moses said, “Today you have been ordained for the service of the Lord, each one at the cost of his son and of his brother, so that he might bestow a blessing upon you this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Moses said to the people, “You have sinned a great sin. And now I will go up to the Lord; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Alas, this people has sinned a great sin. They have made for themselves gods of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, if you will forgive their sin—but if not, please blot me out of your book that you have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against me, I will blot out of my book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now go, lead the people to the place about which I have spoken to you; behold, my angel shall go before you. Nevertheless, in the day when I visit, I will visit their sin upon them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord sent a plague on the people, because they made the calf, the one that Aaron made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Depart; go up from here, you and the people whom you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring I will give it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey; but I will not go up among you, lest I consume you on the way, for you are a stiff-necked people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people heard this disastrous word, they mourned, and no one put on his ornaments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had said to Moses, “Say to the people of Israel, ‘You are a stiff-necked people; if for a single moment I should go up among you, I would consume you. So now take off your ornaments, that I may know what to do with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the people of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments, from Mount Horeb onwards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, far off from the camp, and he called it the tent of meeting. And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the tent of meeting, which was outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people would rise up, and each would stand at his tent door, and watch Moses until he had gone into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the tent, and the Lord would speak with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance of the tent, all the people would rise up and worship, each at his tent door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Lord used to speak to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. When Moses turned again into the camp, his assistant Joshua the son of Nun, a young man, would not depart from the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the Lord, “See, you say to me, ‘Bring up this people’, but you have not let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have also found favour in my sight.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, if I have found favour in your sight, please show me now your ways, that I may know you in order to find favour in your sight. Consider too that this nation is your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “If your presence will not go with me, do not bring us up from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how shall it be known that I have found favour in your sight, I and your people? Is it not in your going with us, so that we are distinct, I and your people, from every other people on the face of the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “This very thing that you have spoken I will do, for you have found favour in my sight, and I know you by name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Please show me your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I will make all my goodness pass before you and will proclaim before you my name ‘The Lord’. And I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But,” he said, “you cannot see my face, for man shall not see me and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Behold, there is a place by me where you shall stand on the rock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and while my glory passes by I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and I will cover you with my hand until I have passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will take away my hand, and you shall see my back, but my face shall not be seen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Cut for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ready by the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to me on the top of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall come up with you, and let no one be seen throughout all the mountain. Let no flocks or herds graze opposite that mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses cut two tablets of stone like the first. And he rose early in the morning and went up on Mount Sinai, as the Lord had commanded him, and took in his hand two tablets of stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord descended in the cloud and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord passed before him and proclaimed, “The Lord, the Lord, a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: keeping steadfast love for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, but who will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children and the children's children, to the third and the fourth generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses quickly bowed his head towards the earth and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “If now I have found favour in your sight, O Lord, please let the Lord go in the midst of us, for it is a stiff-necked people, and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Behold, I am making a covenant. Before all your people I will do marvels, such as have not been created in all the earth or in any nation. And all the people among whom you are shall see the work of the Lord, for it is an awesome thing that I will do with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Observe what I command you this day. Behold, I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land to which you go, lest it become a snare in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall tear down their altars and break their pillars and cut down their Asherim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for you shall worship no other god, for the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and when they whore after their gods and sacrifice to their gods and you are invited, you eat of his sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you take of their daughters for your sons, and their daughters whore after their gods and make your sons whore after their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not make for yourself any gods of cast metal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib, for in the month Abib you came out from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that open the womb are mine, all your male livestock, the firstborn of cow and sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, or if you will not redeem it you shall break its neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. And none shall appear before me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest. In ploughing time and in harvest you shall rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall observe the Feast of Weeks, the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at the year's end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times in the year shall all your males appear before the Lord God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will cast out nations before you and enlarge your borders; no one shall covet your land, when you go up to appear before the Lord your God three times in the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with anything leavened, or let the sacrifice of the Feast of the Passover remain until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The best of the firstfruits of your ground you shall bring to the house of the Lord your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Write these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he was there with the Lord for forty days and forty nights. He neither ate bread nor drank water. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai, with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand as he came down from the mountain, Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone because he had been talking with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and all the people of Israel saw Moses, and behold, the skin of his face shone, and they were afraid to come near him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the leaders of the congregation returned to him, and Moses talked with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards all the people of Israel came near, and he commanded them all that the Lord had spoken with him in Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses went in before the Lord to speak with him, he would remove the veil, until he came out. And when he came out and told the people of Israel what he was commanded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the people of Israel would see the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses' face was shining. And Moses would put the veil over his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assembled all the congregation of the people of Israel and said to them, “These are the things that the Lord has commanded you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days work shall be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to the Lord. Whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall kindle no fire in all your dwelling places on the Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to all the congregation of the people of Israel, “This is the thing that the Lord has commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take from among you a contribution to the Lord. Whoever is of a generous heart, let him bring the Lord's contribution: gold, silver, and bronze;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen; goats' hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: tanned rams' skins, and goatskins; acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and onyx stones and stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let every skilful craftsman among you come and make all that the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its hooks and its frames, its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark with its poles, the mercy seat, and the veil of the screen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table with its poles and all its utensils, and the bread of the Presence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lampstand also for the light, with its utensils and its lamps, and the oil for the light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of incense, with its poles, and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen for the door, at the door of the tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils, the basin and its stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings of the court, its pillars and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pegs of the tabernacle and the pegs of the court, and their cords;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the finely worked garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, for their service as priests.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation of the people of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came, everyone whose heart stirred him, and everyone whose spirit moved him, and brought the Lord's contribution to be used for the tent of meeting, and for all its service, and for the holy garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came, both men and women. All who were of a willing heart brought brooches and earrings and signet rings and armlets, all sorts of gold objects, every man dedicating an offering of gold to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who possessed blue or purple or scarlet yarns or fine linen or goats' hair or tanned rams' skins or goatskins brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who could make a contribution of silver or bronze brought it as the Lord's contribution. And everyone who possessed acacia wood of any use in the work brought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every skilful woman spun with her hands, and they all brought what they had spun in blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the women whose hearts stirred them to use their skill spun the goats' hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the leaders brought onyx stones and stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastpiece,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spices and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men and women, the people of Israel, whose heart moved them to bring anything for the work that the Lord had commanded by Moses to be done brought it as a freewill offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to the people of Israel, “See, the Lord has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill, with intelligence, with knowledge, and with all craftsmanship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to devise artistic designs, to work in gold and silver and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, for work in every skilled craft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has inspired him to teach, both him and Oholiab the son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has filled them with skill to do every sort of work done by an engraver or by a designer or by an embroiderer in blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, or by a weaver—by any sort of workman or skilled designer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bezalel and Oholiab and every craftsman in whom the Lord has put skill and intelligence to know how to do any work in the construction of the sanctuary shall work in accordance with all that the Lord has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab and every craftsman in whose mind the Lord had put skill, everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to do the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they received from Moses all the contribution that the people of Israel had brought for doing the work on the sanctuary. They still kept bringing him freewill offerings every morning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that all the craftsmen who were doing every sort of task on the sanctuary came, each from the task that he was doing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Moses, “The people bring much more than enough for doing the work that the Lord has commanded us to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave command, and word was proclaimed throughout the camp, “Let no man or woman do anything more for the contribution for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the material they had was sufficient to do all the work, and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the craftsmen among the workmen made the tabernacle with ten curtains. They were made of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet yarns, with cherubim skilfully worked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains were the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made loops of blue on the edge of the outermost curtain of the first set. Likewise he made them on the edge of the outermost curtain of the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made fifty loops on the one curtain, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was in the second set. The loops were opposite one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to the other with clasps. So the tabernacle was a single whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle. He made eleven curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. The eleven curtains were the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made fifty loops on the edge of the outermost curtain of one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the other connecting curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made fifty clasps of bronze to couple the tent together that it might be a single whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made for the tent a covering of tanned rams' skins and goatskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the upright frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits was the length of a frame, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each frame had two tenons for fitting together. He did this for all the frames of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The frames for the tabernacle he made thus: twenty frames for the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made forty bases of silver under the twenty frames, two bases under one frame for its two tenons, and two bases under the next frame for its two tenons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty frames
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty bases of silver, two bases under one frame and two bases under the next frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the rear of the tabernacle westward he made six frames.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made two frames for corners of the tabernacle in the rear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were separate beneath but joined at the top, at the first ring. He made two of them this way for the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were eight frames with their bases of silver: sixteen bases, under every frame two bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made bars of acacia wood, five for the frames of one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the tabernacle at the rear westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the middle bar to run from end to end halfway up the frames.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid the frames with gold, and made their rings of gold for holders for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the veil of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen; with cherubim skilfully worked into it he made it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for it he made four pillars of acacia and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold, and he cast for them four bases of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made a screen for the entrance of the tent, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, embroidered with needlework,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and its five pillars with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals, and their fillets were of gold, but their five bases were of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Two cubits and a half was its length, a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a moulding of gold round it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cast for it four rings of gold for its four feet, two rings on its one side and two rings on its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made a mercy seat of pure gold. Two cubits and a half was its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made two cherubim of gold. He made them of hammered work on the two ends of the mercy seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one cherub on one end, and one cherub on the other end. Of one piece with the mercy seat he made the cherubim on its two ends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim spread out their wings above, overshadowing the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces one to another; towards the mercy seat were the faces of the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made the table of acacia wood. Two cubits was its length, a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made a moulding of gold round it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made a rim round it a handbreadth wide, and made a moulding of gold round the rim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast for it four rings of gold and fastened the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Close to the frame were the rings, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the poles of acacia wood to carry the table, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the vessels of pure gold that were to be on the table, its plates and dishes for incense, and its bowls and flagons with which to pour drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of hammered work. Its base, its stem, its cups, its calyxes, and its flowers were of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were six branches going out of its sides, three branches of the lampstand out of one side of it and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three cups made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on one branch, and three cups made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on the other branch—so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the lampstand itself were four cups made like almond blossoms, with their calyxes and flowers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a calyx of one piece with it under each pair of the six branches going out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their calyxes and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole of it was a single piece of hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made its seven lamps and its tongs and its trays of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made it and all its utensils out of a talent of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the altar of incense of acacia wood. Its length was a cubit, and its breadth was a cubit. It was square, and two cubits was its height. Its horns were of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold, its top and round its sides and its horns. And he made a moulding of gold round it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and made two rings of gold on it under its moulding, on two opposite sides of it, as holders for the poles with which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the holy anointing oil also, and the pure fragrant incense, blended as by the perfumer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. Five cubits was its length, and five cubits its breadth. It was square, and three cubits was its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made horns for it on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made all the utensils of the altar, the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the firepans. He made all its utensils of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made for the altar a grating, a network of bronze, under its ledge, extending halfway down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast four rings on the four corners of the bronze grating as holders for the poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the poles through the rings on the sides of the altar to carry it with them. He made it hollow, with boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the basin of bronze and its stand of bronze, from the mirrors of the ministering women who ministered in the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the court. For the south side the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a hundred cubits;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their twenty pillars and their twenty bases were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the north side there were hangings of a hundred cubits, their twenty pillars, their twenty bases were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their ten pillars, and their ten bases; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the front to the east, fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for one side of the gate were fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so for the other side. On both sides of the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the hangings round the court were of fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the bases for the pillars were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver. The overlaying of their capitals was also of silver, and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the screen for the gate of the court was embroidered with needlework in blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen. It was twenty cubits long and five cubits high in its breadth, corresponding to the hangings of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their pillars were four in number. Their four bases were of bronze, their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals and their fillets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the pegs for the tabernacle and for the court all round were of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the records of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, as they were recorded at the commandment of Moses, the responsibility of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the Lord commanded Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with him was Oholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver and designer and embroiderer in blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold that was used for the work, in all the construction of the sanctuary, the gold from the offering, was twenty-nine talents and 730 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The silver from those of the congregation who were recorded was a hundred talents and 1,775 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a beka a head (that is, half a shekel, by the shekel of the sanctuary), for everyone who was listed in the records, from twenty years old and upwards, for 603,550 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hundred talents of silver were for casting the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the veil; a hundred bases for the hundred talents, a talent a base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the pillars and overlaid their capitals and made fillets for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bronze that was offered was seventy talents and 2,400 shekels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with it he made the bases for the entrance of the tent of meeting, the bronze altar and the bronze grating for it and all the utensils of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the bases round the court, and the bases of the gate of the court, all the pegs of the tabernacle, and all the pegs round the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the blue and purple and scarlet yarns they made finely woven garments, for ministering in the Holy Place. They made the holy garments for Aaron, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the ephod of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they hammered out gold leaf, and he cut it into threads to work into the blue and purple and the scarlet yarns, and into the fine twined linen, in skilled design.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made for the ephod attaching shoulder pieces, joined to it at its two edges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the skilfully woven band on it was of one piece with it and made like it, of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold filigree, and engraved like the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod to be stones of remembrance for the sons of Israel, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the breastpiece, in skilled work, in the style of the ephod, of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was square. They made the breastpiece doubled, a span its length and a span its breadth when doubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set in it four rows of stones. A row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle was the first row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in settings of gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were twelve stones with their names according to the names of the sons of Israel. They were like signets, each engraved with its name, for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made on the breastpiece twisted chains like cords, of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made two settings of gold filigree and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two edges of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put the two cords of gold in the two rings at the edges of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They attached the two ends of the two cords to the two settings of filigree. Thus they attached it in front to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made two rings of gold, and put them at the two ends of the breastpiece, on its inside edge next to the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made two rings of gold, and attached them in front to the lower part of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, at its seam above the skilfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they bound the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, so that it should lie on the skilfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastpiece should not come loose from the ephod, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made the robe of the ephod woven all of blue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the opening of the robe in it was like the opening in a garment, with a binding round the opening, so that it might not tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the hem of the robe they made pomegranates of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates all round the hem of the robe, between the pomegranates—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate around the hem of the robe for ministering, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also made the coats, woven of fine linen, for Aaron and his sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the turban of fine linen, and the caps of fine linen, and the linen undergarments of fine twined linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sash of fine twined linen and of blue and purple and scarlet yarns, embroidered with needlework, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it an inscription, like the engraving of a signet, “Holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they tied to it a cord of blue to fasten it on the turban above, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting was finished, and the people of Israel did according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses; so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its utensils, its hooks, its frames, its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the covering of tanned rams' skins and goatskins, and the veil of the screen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark of the testimony with its poles and the mercy seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table with all its utensils, and the bread of the Presence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lampstand of pure gold and its lamps with the lamps set and all its utensils, and the oil for the light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the golden altar, the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen for the entrance of the tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the bronze altar, and its grating of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin and its stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings of the court, its pillars, and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, and its pegs; and all the utensils for the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the finely worked garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons for their service as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that the Lord had commanded Moses, so the people of Israel had done all the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it; as the Lord had commanded, so had they done it. Then Moses blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of the first month you shall erect the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put in it the ark of the testimony, and you shall screen the ark with the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall bring in the table and arrange it, and you shall bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and set up the screen for the door of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set up the court all round, and hang up the screen for the gate of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and consecrate it and all its furniture, so that it may become holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and consecrate the altar, so that the altar may become most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also anoint the basin and its stand, and consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and shall wash them with water
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put on Aaron the holy garments. And you shall anoint him and consecrate him, that he may serve me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring his sons also and put coats on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may serve me as priests. And their anointing shall admit them to a perpetual priesthood throughout their generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Moses did; according to all that the Lord commanded him, so he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was erected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses erected the tabernacle. He laid its bases, and set up its frames, and put in its poles, and raised up its pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent over it, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the testimony and put it into the ark, and put the poles on the ark and set the mercy seat above on the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the table in the tent of meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and arranged the bread on it before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the lampstand in the tent of meeting, opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set up the lamps before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the veil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and burned fragrant incense on it, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put in place the screen for the door of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set the altar of burnt offering at the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it for washing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with which Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went into the tent of meeting, and when they approached the altar, they washed, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he erected the court round the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was not able to enter the tent of meeting because the cloud settled on it, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throughout all their journeys, whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the people of Israel would set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the cloud was not taken up, then they did not set out till the day that it was taken up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the cloud of the Lord was on the tabernacle by day, and fire was in it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel throughout all their journeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator
